message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the use of feedback alignment, a learning algorithm for deep neural networks, in the context of convolutional networks. This makes it likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the comparison of feedback alignment with backpropagation, which is a popular learning algorithm in machine learning. This makes it likely to also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper specifically focuses on convolutional networks, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks, making it likely to belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of neural networks in artificial intelligence, making it likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the importance of mechanisms that promote alignment of feedforward and feedback weights, which is relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
